definitions.definition: The blundering use of an absurdly inappropriate word or expression in place of a similar-sounding one.
examples: The script employed malapropism to great effect.
The translator matched every malapropism in the original with one from his own language.
The humor comes from all the malapropisms .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The blundering use of an absurdly inappropriate word or expression in place of a similar-sounding one.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) An instance of this; malaprop .
